titleStmt.title: The rule of saynt Augustyne, bothe in latyn and englysshe, with two exposicyons. And also the same rule agayn onely in englysshe without latyn or exposicyon The tra[n]slatour doth aduyse [and] cou[n]seyll all the disciples of this rule to bere alway one of these bokes upo[n] them syth they ben so portatyue, [and] may be had for so small a pryce.
Regula. English
titleStmt.author: Augustine, Saint, Bishop of Hippo.
Hugh, of Saint-Victor, 1096?-1141.
Whitford, Richard, fl. 1495-1555?

titleStmt.title: The rule of saynt Augustyne, bothe in latyn and englysshe, with two exposicyons. And also the same rule agayn onely in englysshe without latyn or exposicyon The tra[n]slatour doth aduyse [and] cou[n]seyll all the disciples of this rule to bere alway one of these bokes upo[n] them syth they ben so portatyue, [and] may be had for so small a pryce.
Regula. English
titleStmt.author: Augustine, Saint, Bishop of Hippo.
Hugh, of Saint-Victor, 1096?-1141.
Whitford, Richard, fl. 1495-1555?

publicationStmt.publisher: In Fletestrete, at the sygne of the Sonne, by me Wynkyn de Worde,
publicationStmt.date: The yere of our lorde god.M.CCCCC.xxv. the xxviij. daye of Nouember] [1525]

notesStmt.note: In two parts: part 1 is Latin text of Augustine's "Regula" with Hugh of Saint-Victor's and Richard Whitford's commentaries (in English) and part 2 is Whitford's English translation of the "Regula". Part 2 has separate title page which reads "Saynt Augustyns rule in englysshe alone" and separate register.
Title from part 2. Imprint from part 1 colophon.
Running title (part 1) reads: Saynt Augustynes rule.
Leaf C6v of part 2 bears printer's device (McKerrow 46b) within border.
Identified as STC 13925 on UMI microfilm reel 68 and STC 25417 on UMI microfilm reel 1590.
Part 2 bound before part 1; filmed as such on UMI microfilm reel 1590. Part 1 only filmed on reel 68.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
Appears at reel 68 (part 1 only) and reel 1590 (both parts) (Bodleian Library).
